intro: Kalaharia spinipes, commonly known as the spiny kalaharia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, woody stems covered in sharp spines. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Kalaharia spinipes is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots and thick foliage to retain moisture. It is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
